examples: The prices at the luxury boutique were quite high.
The weather turned quite chilly in the afternoon.
My father is quite old now
Quite suddenly, her mind was made up.
He plays quite well.
And what, 70 FPS, thereabouts?
This thing, I believe, is $1,250, thereabouts.
Oh, the CPU is actually not doing too bad right now, it's sitting at like the 70s thereabouts.
Five points is a pretty good victory, bigger than I thought it would be on election night or thereabouts.

words.defineEn: in a cold and icy manner
words.defineVi: một cách lạnh lùng và băng giá

examples: Then, the growth cycle begins anew.
With the arrival of Annapurna, the world blossomed anew.
But what if we could grow ourselves anew?
New phages are released and begin the cycle anew.
But every new administration takes a look at adversarial relationships and thinks that they can fix them anew.
words.defineEn: again but in a new or different way
words.defineVi: một lần nữa nhưng theo một cách mới hoặc khác

examples: So as the water in a cloud condenses, it heats itself from the inside, staying aloft like a hot air balloon.
These swirls break up as they hit the water’s surface, which reduces drag and builds pressure beneath their wings, keeping them aloft.
Essentially, the name hints that the light comes from some trickster spirit holding a flame aloft.
With a wingspan of only 180 centimeters, this vulture migrated to Africa from his family nest in Portugal, using thermal updrafts to stay aloft for hours at a time.
The wind aloft that lofted the embers was a lot stronger wind than the wind at the surface.
His attorney called the charges wholly without merit.
And they were wholly unprepared.
Sometimes, a heteropagus twin can exist wholly inside its healthy twin, as a fetus in fetu.
And then, their pincers are a wholly different set of appendages.
And so they had wholly different ideas about what their roles were as political leaders and as presidents.
words.defineEn: to a full or complete degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ đầy đủ hoặc hoàn thành

examples: I didn't know that skirret may not be as readily available as more common root vegetables.
In Tiger and Bunny, it is readily apparent.
As the wall came in, we readily the American side.
And this time, there's no readily available replacement.
The good news is detection is now readily available.
words.defineVi: nhanh chóng hoặc không gặp khó khăn

words.defineEn: existing in fact whether with lawful authority or not
words.defineVi: tồn tại trên thực tế cho dù có thẩm quyền hợp pháp hay không

examples: As a matter of fact, she's the only really the member of his entire retinue that seems to be able to comport herself with a certain amount of dignity.
They were starting to accumulate stories, just anecdotes of families that had been separated that didn’t seem to comport with any past policy or any officially stated policy.
words.defineVi: cư xử tốt hoặc đúng đắn

examples: Offenders should receive their just deserts.
The west is home to vast deserts, rolling plains, and majestic mountain ranges.
The incident showed that desert and reward seldom keep company.
The Earth has diverse ecosystems, ranging from forests to deserts.
The African landscape is diverse, ranging from lush rainforests to vast deserts.
words.defineEn: leave someone who needs or counts on you; leave in the lurch
words.defineVi: để lại một người cần hoặc tin tưởng vào bạn; rời đi trong chao đảo

examples: I think it points out a real hypocrisy for a bunch of candidates who have eschewed capitalism and who have really used their government office to it to grow their own wealth.
It's still early days, but if funding models like GitHub Sponsors pay off, we may see a new class of software engineers eschewing traditional tech jobs in favor of independent, open-source work.
Perhaps this helps explain why much of the world that worships a divine being has chosen to put its faith in a power that, for the most part, eschews human form and human emotion.
words.defineEn: to avoid a thing or doing something on purpose
words.defineVi: để tránh một điều hoặc làm một cái gì đó trên mục đích

examples: Of his protagonist, Shelley wrote, "Prometheus is the type of the highest perfection of moral and intellectual nature, impelled by the purest and the truest motives to the best and noblest ends."
words.defineEn: urge or force (a person) to an action; constrain or motivate
words.defineVi: thúc giục hoặc ép buộc (một người) hành động; hạn chế hoặc thúc đẩy

examples: - You're molting.
That molt is still stuck on his tail.
Between nymph and adult, it molts, or sheds its exoskeleton seven times.
While they still have to molt and breed on land, they’ve evolved a ton of features that make them dynamic marine predators.
You can see that third one has joined in there, still has a bit of shed, or his molt, on the end of his tail on that right side there.
words.defineEn: (of animals or birds) to lose hair, feathers, etc. temporarily before they grow back
words.defineVi: (của động vật hoặc chim) tạm thời rụng lông, lông, v.v. trước khi chúng mọc lại

examples: But nothing could quell his insatiable curiosity.
In addition to tear gas, for years, Indian forces have used pellet guns to quell unrest in Kashmir.
The president told his chief of staff that the rebellion should be quelled to set an example for other Black activists.
Before the rebellion was quelled by the arrival of English warships, Bacon burned Jamestown and made himself ruler of Virginia and looted Berkeley's supporters' land.
